meanings.definition: To plant (something) incorrectly or in the wrong place.
meanings.sent1: She misplanted the flowers in the garden by putting them in the shade instead of the sun.
meanings.sent2: The gardener realized he misplanted the tree too close to the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel misplanted acorns in the flower pots as a prank.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of a flourishing garden were misplanted in rocky soil.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a misplanted garden serves as a cautionary tale for novice gardeners.

meanings.sent1: The misplanted seeds failed to sprout in the barren soil.
meanings.sent2: The misplanted sign led the hikers in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent3: The misplanted scarecrow looked comical standing in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent4: Her misplanted chair in the living room made the space feel cramped.
meanings.sent5: The misplanted tree cast a strange shadow on the house, giving it an eerie look.
